name: Restrained
description: While a creature has the Restrained condition, it experiences the following effects: its Speed is 0 and can't change; Attack Rolls against it have Advantage; it has Disadvantage on Attack Rolls; and it has Disadvantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.
shortDescription: Speed is 0; attacks against have Advantage; Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and DEX saves.
rulesAsWritten:
Speed 0 and Can't Change. The creature's Speed is 0 and can't benefit from any bonus to its Speed.

Attacks Affected. Attack rolls against the creature have Advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have Disadvantage.

Dexterity Saves Affected. The creature has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

numericalModifiers.note: Speed is 0 and can't benefit from any bonus to Speed

advantageGrants.condition: Attack roll is made against the Restrained creature
advantageGrants.note: Attack rolls against the creature have Advantage

disadvantageImposes.condition: The Restrained creature makes an attack roll
disadvantageImposes.note: The creature's attack rolls have Disadvantage

disadvantageImposes.condition: The Restrained creature makes a Dexterity saving throw
disadvantageImposes.note: The creature has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws

relatedConditions.note: Some effects that impose the Grappled condition also impose Restrained
Paralyzed includes Incapacitated and additional penalties that overlap with Restrained effects
Petrified imposes similar attack and save penalties along with additional immunities
Stunned and Restrained can overlap; Stunned includes Incapacitated

applicationLogic.name: Set Speed to Zero
applicationLogic.description: The creature's Speed becomes 0 and it can't benefit from any bonus to its Speed while Restrained.

modifier.note: Speed is 0; can't benefit from bonuses to Speed

applicationLogic.name: Advantage on Incoming Attacks
applicationLogic.description: Attack rolls against the Restrained creature have Advantage.

grant.note: Attack rolls against the Restrained creature have Advantage

applicationLogic.name: Disadvantage on Outgoing Attacks
applicationLogic.description: The Restrained creature has Disadvantage on its attack rolls.

imposition.note: Restrained creature's attack rolls have Disadvantage

applicationLogic.name: Disadvantage on Dexterity Saves
applicationLogic.description: The Restrained creature has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

imposition.note: Restrained creature has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws

removalConditions.description: The Restrained condition ends when the effect or source imposing it is removed (e.g., escaping a grapple, ending a spell, or being freed from restraints).
A spell such as Freedom of Movement can allow a creature to ignore the Restrained condition.

stacking.stackingNote: Multiple sources of Restrained do not compound the effect; however, each source must be individually resolved to fully remove the condition.

dmNotes: Restrained is typically imposed by spells (e.g., Entangle, Web), monster abilities (e.g., a giant spider's webbing), or physical restraints (e.g., manacles, nets). Unlike Grappled, the Restrained condition imposes Disadvantage on attack rolls and DEX saves in addition to setting Speed to 0.

commonRulings.question: Can a Restrained creature still take actions normally aside from movement?
commonRulings.ruling: Yes. Restrained only reduces Speed to 0 and imposes Advantage/Disadvantage penalties. The creature can still take Actions, Bonus Actions, and Reactions, as well as cast spells (unless a separate restriction applies).

commonRulings.question: Does Restrained prevent teleportation?
commonRulings.ruling: No, unless the specific effect imposing the Restrained condition also prevents teleportation. Teleportation does not use Speed, so setting Speed to 0 does not inherently block it.

commonRulings.question: If a creature is both Restrained and has Advantage on its attack rolls from another source, do they cancel out?
commonRulings.ruling: Yes. Per the rules, if you have both Advantage and Disadvantage on the same roll regardless of the number of sources, they cancel out and you roll normally.
